triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: The foundation for the paper's reasoning enhancement approach, training LLMs with reinforcement learning to improve their reasoning capabilities.

triples.name: Chain of thought
triples.relevance: The paper compares its RL approach to chain-of-thought prompting as a baseline method for multi-step reasoning.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The core technique proposed to incentivize reasoning in LLMs without requiring human-labeled reasoning trajectories.

triples.name: Supervised learning
triples.relevance: The paper contrasts its RL approach with conventional supervised learning on human-demonstrated reasoning patterns.

triples.name: Prompt engineering
triples.relevance: Related to the chain-of-thought technique mentioned in the abstract as a foundational approach to reasoning.

triples.name: Deep learning
triples.relevance: The underlying deep learning architecture that powers large language models used in the study.

triples.name: Automated reasoning
triples.relevance: The paper develops emergent automated reasoning patterns including self-reflection and verification through RL.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: General field addressing the long-standing challenge of reasoning that the paper advances through novel RL methods.

triples.name: Automated theorem proving
triples.relevance: Mathematics and formal reasoning tasks are among the verifiable domains where the proposed RL framework is tested.
